capabilities.description: Lists EdgeKV permissions available within the Akamai access group.

groupId.description: Identifies the Akamai access group specified when the namespace was created.

groupName.description: Name of an Akamai access group you assign to a new namespace.

groups.description: List of Akamai access groups with EdgeKV capabilities.

capabilities.description: Lists EdgeKV permissions available within the Akamai access group.

groupId.description: Identifies the Akamai access group specified when the namespace was created.

groupName.description: Name of an Akamai access group you assign to a new namespace.

dataaccesspolicy.description: Specifies which Akamai delivery networks an EdgeKV namespace can access data from by default, either the Enhanced TLS network or both the Enhanced and Standard TLS networks.

allowNamespacePolicyOverride.description: Overrides the default `dataAccessPolicy` when creating a new namespace. A value of `true` allows you to override the `dataAccessPolicy` when creating a namespace. A value of `false` prevents new namespaces from overriding the default `dataAccessPolicy`.

restrictDataAccess.description: Default `dataAccessPolicy` for new namespaces. A value of `true` allows new namespaces to access Akamai's Enhanced TLS network. A value of `false` allows access on both the Enhanced TLS and the Standard TLS networks.

errorCode.description: Internal error code used to assist with troubleshooting by Akamai employees.

instance.description: Reference to unique instance of the error.

status.description: The HTTP code for the error.

title.description: Text representation of the HTTP error code.

initialize-200.description: Lists properties related to EdgeKV initialization.

accountStatus.description: __Read-only__ The `INITIALIZED` status indicates that the EdgeKV and the CP code have been provisioned in production and staging networks. If EdgeKV has not been initialized in both networks, the value of `UNINITIALIZED` will be shown. A value of `PENDING` will be shown if a previous initialization request is currently processing for the account.

cpcode.description: __Read-only__ CP code created to track the EdgeKV traffic. Make sure you don't purge content associated with this CP code to avoid degradation in your EdgeKV performance. A value of `null` shows that the account has not been initialized.

allOf.description: Specifies which Akamai delivery networks an EdgeKV namespace can access data from by default, either the Enhanced TLS network or both the Enhanced and Standard TLS networks.

allowNamespacePolicyOverride.description: Overrides the default `dataAccessPolicy` when creating a new namespace. A value of `true` allows you to override the `dataAccessPolicy` when creating a namespace. A value of `false` prevents new namespaces from overriding the default `dataAccessPolicy`.

restrictDataAccess.description: Default `dataAccessPolicy` for new namespaces. A value of `true` allows new namespaces to access Akamai's Enhanced TLS network. A value of `false` allows access on both the Enhanced TLS and the Standard TLS networks.

productionStatus.description: __Read-only__ The `INITIALIZED` status indicates that the EdgeKV has been provisioned on the production network. A value of `UNINITIALIZED` will be shown if initialization has not been attempted or the attempt has failed. A value of `PENDING` will be shown if a previous initialization request is currently processing for the account.

stagingStatus.description: __Read-only__ The `INITIALIZED` status indicates that the EdgeKV has been provisioned on staging network. A value of `UNINITIALIZED` will be shown if initialization has not been attempted or the attempt has failed. A value of `PENDING` will be shown if a previous initialization request is currently processing for the account.

initialize-put.description: Represents an EdgeKV data access policy.

dataAccessPolicy.description: Specifies which Akamai delivery networks an EdgeKV namespace can access data from by default, either the Enhanced TLS network or both the Enhanced and Standard TLS networks.

allowNamespacePolicyOverride.description: Overrides the default `dataAccessPolicy` when creating a new namespace. A value of `true` allows you to override the `dataAccessPolicy` when creating a namespace. A value of `false` prevents new namespaces from overriding the default `dataAccessPolicy`.

restrictDataAccess.description: Default `dataAccessPolicy` for new namespaces. A value of `true` allows new namespaces to access Akamai's Enhanced TLS network. A value of `false` allows access on both the Enhanced TLS and the Standard TLS networks.

groupId.description: The Akamai access group the namespace is assigned to. A value of `0` makes the namespace available to all groups on the account with EdgeKV capabilities.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for Akamai's EdgeKV API

If EdgeKV has not been initialized in both networks, the value of `UNINITIALIZED` will be shown. A value of `PENDING` will be shown if a previous initialization request is currently processing for the account.

put.description: You only need to initialize EdgeKV once. This operation adds the `default` EdgeKV namespace to Akamai's `STAGING` and `PRODUCTION` networks. It also creates a new dedicated CP code for you to track your EdgeKV usage. You won't be able to use any of the EdgeKV API operations or your EdgeKV database until initialization completes. You should only use the default namespace for experimentation and testing purposes. When deploying your EdgeKV database in production, use a new namespace with a different name. You can also specify a `dataAccessPolicy` to run this operation. The `dataAccessPolicy` determines if you can create new namespaces only on Akamai’s Enhanced TLS network, or both the Enhanced TLS and Standard TLS networks. By default, all existing namespaces use only the Enhanced TLS network.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's EdgeKV API

post.description: Creates a namespace on Akamai's `STAGING` or `PRODUCTION` network. You should create namespaces in both networks so that you can test your EdgeWorkers code on staging.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's EdgeKV API

parameters.description: For customers who manage more than one account, this [runs the operation from another account](https://techdocs.akamai.com/developer/docs/manage-many-accounts-with-one-api-client). The Identity and Access Management API provides a [list of available account switch keys](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iam-api/reference/get-client-account-switch-keys).
parameters.name: accountSwitchKey

dataAccessPolicy.description: Overrides the default data access policy. If not specified, all new namespaces use the current `dataAccessPolicy`. The default data access policy is defined when first initializing EdgeKV. You can change the settings for new namespaces by running the [Modify the default data access policy](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edgekv/reference/put-auth-database) operation after initialization. You can't change the data access policy after you create a namespace.

policyType.description: __Read-only__ Indicates if the default data access policy has been `inherited` or `overridden`.

restrictDataAccess.description: Set a data access policy to override the default setting. You can only change the data access policy for a namespace if `allowNamespacePolicyOverride`  is set to `true` when first initializing EdgeKV. You can also use the [Modify the default data access policy](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edgekv/reference/put-auth-database) endpoint to change the settings after initialization is complete.

geoLocation.description: Specifies the storage location for data when creating a namespace on the production network. This can help optimize performance by storing data where most of your users are located. Once you set this value, you can't modify it. The value defaults to `US` on the `STAGING` and `PRODUCTION` networks. The available locations on the `PRODUCTION` network also include `EU` (Europe), `JP` (Japan), and `GLOBAL`. The `GLOBAL` location automatically replicates data to `US`, `EU`, and `JP` storage locations. If you use the `GLOBAL` location, reads are faster but write operations are slighly slower.

groupId.description: The Akamai access group the namespace is assigned to. A value of `0` makes the namespace available to all Akamai access groups on the account with EdgeKV capabilities.

retentionInSeconds.description: Retention period of underlying data, represented in seconds. Accepts values between `86400` for one day and `315360000` for 10 years. You can also enter a value of `0` to retain data indefinitely.

oneOf.title: Retain data for a specific period

dataAccessPolicy.description: Overrides the default data access policy. If not specified, all new namespaces use the current `dataAccessPolicy`. The default data access policy is defined when first initializing EdgeKV. You can change the settings for new namespaces by running the [Modify the default data access policy](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edgekv/reference/put-auth-database) operation after initialization. You can't change the data access policy after you create a namespace.

policyType.description: __Read-only__ Indicates if the default data access policy has been `inherited` or `overridden`.

restrictDataAccess.description: Set a data access policy to override the default setting. You can only change the data access policy for a namespace if `allowNamespacePolicyOverride`  is set to `true` when first initializing EdgeKV. You can also use the [Modify the default data access policy](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edgekv/reference/put-auth-database) endpoint to change the settings after initialization is complete.

geoLocation.description: Specifies the storage location for data when creating a namespace on the production network. This can help optimize performance by storing data where most of your users are located. Once you set this value, you can't modify it. The value defaults to `US` on the `STAGING` and `PRODUCTION` networks. The available locations on the `PRODUCTION` network also include `EU` (Europe), `JP` (Japan), and `GLOBAL`. The `GLOBAL` location automatically replicates data to `US`, `EU`, and `JP` storage locations. If you use the `GLOBAL` location, reads are faster but write operations are slighly slower.

retentionInSeconds.description: Retention period of underlying data, represented in seconds. Accepts values between `86400` for one day and `315360000` for 10 years. You can also enter a value of `0` to retain data indefinitely.

policyType.description: __Read-only__ Indicates if the default data access policy has been `inherited` or `overridden`.

restrictDataAccess.description: Set a data access policy to override the default setting. You can only change the data access policy for a namespace if `allowNamespacePolicyOverride`  is set to `true` when first initializing EdgeKV. You can also use the [Modify the default data access policy](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edgekv/reference/put-auth-database) endpoint to change the settings after initialization is complete.

geoLocation.description: Specifies the storage location for data when creating a namespace on the production network. This can help optimize performance by storing data where most of your users are located. Once you set this value, you can't modify it. The value defaults to `US` on the `STAGING` and `PRODUCTION` networks. The available locations on the `PRODUCTION` network also include `EU` (Europe), `JP` (Japan), and `GLOBAL`. The `GLOBAL` location automatically replicates data to `US`, `EU`, and `JP` storage locations. If you use the `GLOBAL` location, reads are faster but write operations are slighly slower.

groupId.description: The Akamai access group the namespace is assigned to. A value of `0` makes the namespace available to all Akamai access groups on the account with EdgeKV capabilities.

retentionInSeconds.description: Retention period of underlying data, represented in seconds. Accepts values between `86400` for one day and `315360000` for 10 years. You can also enter a value of `0` to retain data indefinitely.

oneOf.title: Retain data for a specific period

errorCode.description: Internal error code used to assist with troubleshooting by Akamai employees.

instance.description: Reference to unique instance of the error.

status.description: The HTTP code for the error.

title.description: Text representation of the HTTP error code.

parameters.name: network

dataAccessPolicy.description: Overrides the default data access policy. If not specified, all new namespaces use the current `dataAccessPolicy`. The default data access policy is defined when first initializing EdgeKV. You can change the settings for new namespaces by running the [Modify the default data access policy](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edgekv/reference/put-auth-database) operation after initialization. You can't change the data access policy after you create a namespace.

policyType.description: __Read-only__ Indicates if the default data access policy has been `inherited` or `overridden`.

The `GLOBAL` location automatically replicates data to `US`, `EU`, and `JP` storage locations. If you use the `GLOBAL` location, reads are faster but write operations are slighly slower.

put.description: You can update the retention period for any existing namespace other than the default namespace. It can take up to five minutes for a new retention policy to apply. The new retention period only applies to data added or updated in the namespace after this operation is complete. The retention period of existing data remains unchanged from the old retention period. Once you perform this operation you can't query the previously existing data. If you want to ensure that all data in the namespace has the same retention period you need to update the entire data set once the retention period has been updated.  To change the access group used to authorize permission to a namespace, see [Reauthorize a namespace](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edgekv/reference/reauthorize-namespace). If you try to run this operation to update the access group, you get a [400 error](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edgekv/reference/400).

The group identifier is a logical container for a set of items stored inside a given namespace.

get.description: View the details of an EdgeKV item (key-value pair) within a group. You need to specify the `namespace` and `group` the item belongs to. This operation returns up to 100 items by default or the number of items specified in the `maxItems`. If there are more than the default or requested items in the specified group, the operation returns a random set of the default or requested items. It can take ten seconds or longer to read an item that has been written to EdgeKV. The API may respond with a 404 error during that period. This is normal behavior for EdgeKV, which is an eventually consistent database.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's EdgeKV API

parameters.description: If specified, maximum number of items to return per request, up to the system [limits](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edgekv/docs/limits).
parameters.name: maxItems

delete.description: Mark an EdgeKV item for deletion. You need to specify the `namespace` and `group` the item belongs to. It can take ten seconds or longer for a deleted item to be removed from the database. If you attempt a read operation before the value has been updated globally, stale data may be returned until the update is complete. This is normal behavior for EdgeKV, which is an eventually consistent database.

post.description: Generate an access token that allows an EdgeWorkers code bundle to access the specified namespace. Any new tokens that you create refresh automatically without expiring. You don't need to update tokens inside your `edgekv_tokens.js` file. Tokens created before the enhanced token workflow implementation will still expire. You need to replace these expired tokens in your code bundle. To learn more about access tokens, refer to the [EdgeKV guide](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edgekv/docs/generate-and-retrieve-edgekv-access-tokens).

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's EdgeKV API

parameters.description: For customers who manage more than one account, this [runs the operation from another account](https://techdocs.akamai.com/developer/docs/manage-many-accounts-with-one-api-client). The Identity and Access Management API provides a [list of available account switch keys](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iam-api/reference/get-client-account-switch-keys).
parameters.name: accountSwitchKey

schema.description: Lists properties related to EdgeKV access token.

allowOnProduction.description: Whether to allow this token access to the Akamai production network.

allowOnStaging.description: Whether to allow this token access to the Akamai staging network.

cpcode.description: __Read-only__ The EdgeKV CP code assigned to the customer account.

expiry.description: Tokens created using the enhanced token workflow have an expiry date, in ISO 8601 format, of `9999-12-31`. Any tokens created before the release of the enhanced workflow display an actual expiry date such as `2025-02-28`.

issueDate.description: Initial token creation date in ISO 8601 format.

latestRefreshDate.description: Most recent token refresh date in ISO 8601 format. A `null` value indicates the token has not yet been refreshed.

name.description: Friendly name of the token. Used when retrieving tokens by name.

additionalProperties.description: List of permissions a token should have on a namespace. This array's key is the name of the namespace that you want to grant permissions to. To list namespaces see, [List namespaces](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edgekv/reference/get-namespaces). You can specify `r` for read, `w` for write, or `d` for delete.

namespacePermissions.description: Namespace identifiers the token should have access to, plus the associated read, write, and delete permissions. All specified namespaces need the same database data access policy. A namespace's data access policy comes from the value of the `restrictDataAccess`, set when creating a namespace.

nextScheduledRefreshDate.description: Next scheduled date of the token refresh in ISO 8601 format.

restrictToEdgeWorkerIds.description: A set of EdgeWorker IDs authorized to access EdgeKV via the token. By default if you omit this array, the token authorizes access for all IDs.

tokenActivationStatus.description: The `IN_PROGRESS` status indicates token activation is still in progress, and it's not yet possible to make successful EdgeKV requests from EdgeWorkers that use the token. Once activation completes, status is `COMPLETE`. Otherwise a value of `ERROR` indicates a problem that prevented activation.

uuid.description: A generated unique identifier for the access token. This should be used in the `edgekv_tokens.js` file.

schema.description: Lists properties related to EdgeKV access token.

allowOnProduction.description: Whether to allow this token access to the Akamai production network.

allowOnStaging.description: Whether to allow this token access to the Akamai staging network.

cpcode.description: __Read-only__ The EdgeKV CP code assigned to the customer account.

expiry.description: Tokens created using the enhanced token workflow have an expiry date, in ISO 8601 format, of `9999-12-31`. Any tokens created before the release of the enhanced workflow display an actual expiry date such as `2025-02-28`.

issueDate.description: Initial token creation date in ISO 8601 format.

latestRefreshDate.description: Most recent token refresh date in ISO 8601 format. A `null` value indicates the token has not yet been refreshed.

name.description: Friendly name of the token. Used when retrieving tokens by name.

additionalProperties.description: List of permissions a token should have on a namespace. This array's key is the name of the namespace that you want to grant permissions to. To list namespaces see, [List namespaces](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edgekv/reference/get-namespaces). You can specify `r` for read, `w` for write, or `d` for delete.

namespacePermissions.description: Namespace identifiers the token should have access to, plus the associated read, write, and delete permissions. All specified namespaces need the same database data access policy. A namespace's data access policy comes from the value of the `restrictDataAccess`, set when creating a namespace.

nextScheduledRefreshDate.description: Next scheduled date of the token refresh in ISO 8601 format.

restrictToEdgeWorkerIds.description: A set of EdgeWorker IDs authorized to access EdgeKV via the token. By default if you omit this array, the token authorizes access for all IDs.

tokenActivationStatus.description: The `IN_PROGRESS` status indicates token activation is still in progress, and it's not yet possible to make successful EdgeKV requests from EdgeWorkers that use the token. Once activation completes, status is `COMPLETE`. Otherwise a value of `ERROR` indicates a problem that prevented activation.

uuid.description: A generated unique identifier for the access token. This should be used in the `edgekv_tokens.js` file.

get.description: Download a previously created EdgeKV access token. To get a token, you need to know the token `name`. Tokens created using the enhanced token workflow don't include the JWT value in the response. To learn more about access tokens, refer to the [EdgeKV guide](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edgekv/docs/generate-and-retrieve-edgekv-access-tokens).

delete.description: Once you revoke an access token, you can't undo it. You also need to update any deployed EdgeWorkers code bundles that use the old token with a new token, or requests to EdgeKV fail. Any requests from an EdgeWorkers code bundle using a revoked token cause a 401 error. To learn more about access tokens, refer to the [EdgeKV guide](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edgekv/docs/generate-and-retrieve-edgekv-access-tokens).
